attributes.action: save our economy by taxing business net profits by tiered percentages!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
i propose thus.

to tax a percentage of a companys net profit.

ok here is how it works, the government gives a series of tax bands in relation to how much profit each company is generating (regardless of the companys total worth). an example is calculated as thus. an imaginary company generates £10,000 profit per quarter, so a tax tier is associated with how much profit the company generates. so it gets taxed e.g 5% of its net profits (so 5% of £10,000 is £500) this in turn will 'regulate' the amount of profits a company can generate. the benefits of this are that companies will still have monies to operate and manage their companies with, and will still generate profits but at a capped rate. this as i see it is an untapped resource for the government and will generate huge amounts of revenue but at a cost, emergency company benefits would have to be a side clause to prevent companies that are doing well from falling into a pit of economic depression. imagine this as a 'safety buffer' for our country's businesses, which these benefits will again 'regulate' and 'smooth out' our failing economy.
